critique: This document is a very minor amendment to an existing executive order concerning pay for uniformed services. It removes the phrase "at his permanent station" from clause (b) of section 403 of Executive Order No. 11157. This change likely broadens the scope of some pay provision, but without knowing the specifics of the original clause, it's difficult to assess the precise impact. Given the limited scope and technical nature, the document has minimal implications for most of the axes. It doesn't touch on immigration, executive power in a significant way, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The ideological tilt is also negligible.
